intro: Calycobolus acutus, commonly known as the sharp-fruited calycobolus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, elongated蒴果 (capsular fruit) that splits open to release its seeds. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The flowers are small and usually pink or white, arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
